conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway/isometric 3D model: extruded walls with thickness, visible floor plane, and interior volumes shown from an elevated angle.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; good isometric angle; clean cutaway with minor simplifications at some wall junctions.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall 3BHK arrangement is broadly consistent (central living/dining, bedrooms distributed around, kitchen on right), but several partitions/toilet layouts and some proportions/opening placements appear simplified or shifted versus the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, living seating, dining) and kitchen/bath fixtures indicated, but some rooms look under-detailed and fixture/element placement does not fully confirm every labeled room from the plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable geometry with consistent materials and clean background; lighting is adequate, though similar wall/floor tones reduce contrast for some openings and partitions.

detected_errors.description: Some internal partition geometry (notably toilet/utility segmentation and a few wall offsets) appears simplified or not perfectly aligned with the 2D plan.
Door/window placements and sizes are not fully verifiable as matching the 2D plan; several openings appear generic rather than plan-exact.
Furniture helps identify bedrooms/living/dining, but not all room identities from the 2D plan are strongly confirmed by fixtures/furnishing (some areas look minimally populated).
Low material contrast between walls and floors slightly reduces structural legibility in tighter spaces.

summary: A valid and clear 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout correspondence, but with noticeable simplification/mismatch in some partitions and opening details compared to the 2D plan.
